name: ConstructNoden
text: Met Mr. Jerry Lynn. Nice people

name: D.J. Griffith
text: Great

name: Tim Klassen
text: Seemed to be a well managed and courteous business

name: Johnny Beckmann
text: I work for company.... Carmen and Wes are good people to work for

name: bob reed
text: A good place to work , i love it

name: Jeff Hasting
text: All friendly

name: Chris Lee
text: Great owners&workers

name: Sean Mattox
text: I work here

name: Rebecca Rolling
text:
(Translated by Google) Gr8 company y'all!

(Original)
Gr8 company y'all!

name: Jill Revette
text:
Cost me $150 due to their poor work on i65. I filed a claim to be reimbursed to which they finally responded to after about 4-5 months and denied my claim. First my windshield was chipped twice by rocks due to their terrible clean up job so my insurance replaced those for free. The second time I was coming the other way on the interest numerous rocks popped and cracked my entire windshield and broke my front Subaru logo plate. The plate cost $50 on ebay and the new windshield cost $100 to which H.O. Weaver & Sons, Inc. denied my claim.

Very poor business. Cannot imagine what a terrible company the must be to ruin hundreds of people's cars due to their SLOPPY and unprofessional work and then deny all responsibilities for it. I had numerous friends also have their windshields damaged and claims denied be this company. So I am out $150 because huge business does not know how to do their job correctly or take responsibility for their actions like an adult. I was personally taken advantage of by this company and I was not even a client. Would highly recommend not hiring these people.

name: Ashley Christopher
text: On windshield #4 thanks to this company. They do NOT clean up work sites properly. They have denied all claims that have been submitted. They have their FB on lock down so no one can comment about it. By far the worst company ever!

name: Bratton McGregor
text: Should probably learn how to use a broom correctly. Ridiculous amount of debris getting thrown around on the interstate. Work that is so bad your making John G Walton look good.

name: Robert Dudley
text: I've lost three windshields due to their work.  They should be shut down,  someone could have been killed! Worthless!!!!!!!!!

name: A. Woody Watkins
text: Horrible WORK ON our Roadways.  HO WEAVER DID work on the I65 North and South in Mobile, Alabama.  Several individuals (in the hundreds) made claims against this company due to the Damage to vehicles during the time HO Weaver did the repaving project and ALL were denied including mine.  I actually feel sorry for people that drive Rangeline Road as HO Weaver is doing work on this road as well.  Expect Damage to your Vehicles.     It is sad that Business like HO Weaver that has been in business as long as they have does such sloppy work, I wonder how they stay in business.

name: David Rees
text: Hosea weavers drivers dumped gravel in a "round about" causing me to crash my motorcycle. The bike was totalled. The incident cost me about 3500 dollars. They acted like children. Lied in small claims court. Had 3 different lawyers on the case. Got rid of their safety officer probably because they were the worst safety wise. Now their causing problems on ALDOT's dime. Wonderful. Hope they finally get what they deserve. Oh yah. The Brookley Field Airport Authority is no better. I gave them the chance the make it right also.

name: Chad Hon
text: They don’t keep the project clean. I have broken my windshield twice driving by their I-65 project. I tried to file a claim but they refuse to answer my calls and messages. Their insurance company (TRIBCO) told me they are currently refusing all claims and to forget about it.  I am told they Have 1200 (so far) similar claims and are rejecting them all.

name: Marilyn Lott
text: I would rate them a '0' if it was a choice. This Co. Is more concerned about cutting corners than in quality, safe roads.  They also are heartless when it comes to employees.  No matter how long they work, they only get one week payed vacation.  40 years = one week

name: Kannice Rogers
text: Horrible company. If I could rate 0 I would. Employees DONT matter.

name: Larry Miller
text: Love the roads they build

name: SynergstSavedByGrace
text:
My experience with H.O. Weaver was quite accidental and quite unpleasant: while stopped at a light, I was rear-ended by one of their truck drivers. As I tried to pull over, the driver pushed past before I had gotten out of the thoroughfare and collided with my bumper a second time, the driver apparently not even noticing that there had been a collision and that a car was still in her path.

Accidents happen. The real problem I have with them was that when questioned by the police and insurance adjusters, the driver claimed that she wasn't moving, and the (double) rear-ending was actually caused by my car backing into her truck!

I can't speak to the rest of their business, but they've already made it clear that they condone dishonesty and can't accept responsibility for their own actions. I could not recommend dealing with them.

name: Arthur Johnson
text: Great Asphalt Company
